q: He also mentioned that Sergey Brin will focus on`` the order of three big initiatives.'' Eric Schmidt didn't elaborate. Turning to competition, Eric Schmidt said he was perplexed by the Facebook obsession because the facts don't support it. ''[ Facebook] has clearly stated they don't want to get into the search business. Facebook users tend to use Google search. Facebook's ads business does not displace our advertising.''

David Letterman did a comedy bit many, many years ago called`` cause and effect,'' or something like that. We recall one of David Letterman 's jokes went like this: Cause: Millions of prairie dogs die of a mysterious disease.`` Effect: McRibs for a limited time. Anyway, that came to mind when we first heard about the documentary Return of the Prairie Bandit, which airs Thursday, Feb. 10 as part of The Nature of Things with David Suzuki on CBC.

People keep calling for growth to slow down, but the growth continues to be stellar. As part of the change, Eric Schmidt will no longer be responsible for the day-to-day operations. was palpable. Here it was, the come-from-behind drive that longtime franchise quarterback Donovan McNabb had failed to produce so many times. Michael Vick had his chance.`` We were very confident,'' Michael Vick said. We thought we were going to win the game. I thought we were going to win the game. I had an upbeat feeling about myself. I felt like I was in control. Michael Vick overthrew tight end Brent Celek on first down. He threw wide of running back LeSean McCoy on second down.
